sources.title: A Bucket of Blood (1959)
sources.description: A Bucket of Bllod is a 1959 B movie, produced and directed by Roger Corman and starring Dick Miller, who plays Walter Paisley, a waiter in a hip cafe frequented by artists and poets. Walter dreams of being an artist as well and all it takes to set him on the right path is a dead cat. You can find out more about A Bucket of Blood at A Passion For Horror .

sources.title: A Bucket of Blood (1959)
sources.description: Nerdy Walter Paisley, a maladroit busboy at a beatnik café who doesn't fit in with the cool scene around him, attempts to woo his beautiful co-worker, Carla, by making a bust of her. When his klutziness results in the death of his landlady's cat, he panics and hides its body under a layer of plaster. But when Carla and her friends enthuse over the resulting artwork, Walter decides to create some bigger and more elaborate pieces using the same artistic process. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/a-bucket-of-blood-1959/

sources.title: A Bucket Of Blood (1959) [Colorized, 4K, 60FPS]
sources.description: A Bucket Of Blood is a 1959 black and white movie film which has been colorised, upscaled to 4K, and frames per second boosted to 60 FPS in 2021 using Artificial Intelligence (A.I) and Google Colab @  https://colab.research.google.com   Technologies used: A.I. Colorizing:  https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify  A.I. Increasing frame rate 60 FPS:  https://rife-vfi.github.io   A.I. Upscaling to 4K:  https://ffmpeg.org   GPU: Google Colab. This movie is in public domain category and it is Copyright free.

sources.title: A Bucket of Blood (1959) ROGER CORMAN
sources.description:
Stars: Dick Miller, Barboura Morris, Antony Carbone
Directed by: Roger Corman
Screenplay: Charles B. Griffith

When a frustrated artist receives acclaim for a plaster-covered dead cat, the desire for more praise leads to an increasingly deadly series of works!

Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: Legendary cult filmmaker Roger Corman has directed
over 50 films and produced nearly 400 more. In the process, he helped launch the careers
of Jack Nicholson, Robert De Niro, Charles Bronson, Sylvester Stallone, Francis Ford Coppola, Martin Scorsese, Ron Howard, Robert Towne, Peter Bogdanovich, and James Cameron!

sources.title: A Bucket of Blood (1959)
sources.description: The Roger Corman Classic with Dick Miller as Walter Paisley, sad and simple-minded busboy, who gains acclaim from the beatnik crowd for his "unique" sculptures such as one named "Murdered Man". Included is the Mpeg2. If you have a program such as DVDAuthorGui, simply load the file and a create a dvd file for burning.

sources.title: A Bucket of Blood
sources.description: Walter is a busboy overly impressed with the cool cats that hang out at The Yellow Door coffee house,and he wonders how tocome "hip"

sources.title: A Bucket of Blood
sources.description: Title: A Bucket of Blood Summary: A dim-witted busboy finds acclaim as an artist for a plaster-covered dead cat that is mistaken as a skillful statuette. The desire for more praise soon leads to an increasingly deadly series of works. Directed by: Roger Corman Actors: Dick Miller, Barboura Morris, Antony Carbone Production Company: Alta Vista Productions Release Date: 21 October 1959 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 Walter Paisley, nerdy busboy at a Bohemian café, is jealous of the talent (and popularity) of its various artistic regulars. But after accidentally killing his landlady's cat and covering the body in plaster to hide the evidence, he is acclaimed as a brilliant sculptor - but his new-found friends want to see more of his work. Lacking any artistic talent whatsoever, Walter has to resort to similar methods to produce new work, and soon people start mysteriously disappearing...

metadata.Plot: Walter Paisley, nerdy busboy at a Bohemian café, is jealous of the talent (and popularity) of its various artistic regulars. But after accidentally killing his landlady's cat and covering the body in plaster to hide the evidence, he is acclaimed as a brilliant sculptor - but his new-found friends want to see more of his work. Lacking any artistic talent whatsoever, Walter has to resort to similar methods to produce new work, and soon people start mysteriously disappearing...
